surfinpy.mu_vs_mu¶

Functions related to the generation of surface phase diagrams as a function of chemical potential

surfinpy.mu_vs_mu.calculate(data, bulk, deltaX, deltaY, xshiftval=0, yshiftval=0, temperature=0, convert_pressure=False, output='Phase.png')[source]¶

Initialise the surface energy calculation. :param data: List containing the dictionary data for each phase :type data: list :param bulk: Dctionary containing data for bulk :type bulk: dictionary :param deltaX: X axis chemical potential values :type deltaX: dictionary :param DeltaY: Y axis chemical potential values :type DeltaY: dictionary :param xshiftval: DFT energy of adsorbing species :type xshiftval: float :param yshiftval: DFT energy of adsorbing species :type yshiftval: float :param temperature: Temperature :type temperature: int :param convert_pressure: Parameter to turn on conversion of chemical potential to pressure :type convert_pressure: bool :param output: Output file name :type output: str

Returns:
Return type:None
surfinpy.mu_vs_mu.calculate_surface_energy(Uo, Uh, yshiftval, xshiftval, Hexcess, Oexcess, B)[source]¶

This function calculates the surface for a given chemical potential of oxygen and hydrogen :param Uo: Chemical potential of Oxygen :param Ho: Chemical potential of Hydrogen :param yshiftval: shift value for y axis :param xshiftval: shift value for x axis :param Hexcess: Excess Y :param Oexcess: Excess X

Returns:SE
Return type:Surface Energy
surfinpy.mu_vs_mu.constants(data, bulk)[source]¶

constants - calculate the surface energy irrespective of chemical potential :param data: :type data: list of dictionaries containg info on each surface :param bulk: :type bulk: bulk dictionary

Returns:
  • Hexcess (Excess for the Y species)
  • Oexcess (Excess for the X species)
surfinpy.mu_vs_mu.pressure(X, T)[source]¶

pressure - Calculate the pressure for chemical potential values :param X: :type X: numpy array - delta mu values :param T: :type T: int - temperature

Returns:pressure
Return type:numpy array - pressure values
surfinpy.mu_vs_mu.scale(X, Xscale)[source]¶
surfinpy.mu_vs_mu.surface_energy_array(data, bulk, X, Y, nsurfaces, xshiftval, yshiftval)[source]¶

This function calculates and returns a 2D numpy array of surface energes for a range of chemical potential values :param data: List containing the dictionary data for each phase :type data: list :param bulk: dictionary containing data for bulk :type bulk: dictionary :param X: X axis chemical potential values :type X: dictionary :param Y: Y axis chemical potential values :type Y: dictionary :param nsurfaces: Number of phases :type nsurfaces: int :param xshiftval: shift value for x axis :type xshiftval: float :param yshiftval: shift value for y axis :type yshiftval: float

Returns:SE_array – array of surface energies matching chemcial potential values
Return type:array like
